title: Kate Middleton colouring book released
text: comments He wants his wife to be seen as more than just a ‘clothes horse’. So Prince William might be surprised to find her the subject of a colouring-in book for sale in the Kensington Palace gift shop. Cashing in on the craze among both adults and children for such books – not to mention the global interest in the Duchess of Cambridge’s fashion – the Colour In Kate book is apparently flying off the shelves. Cashing in on the craze among both adults and children for such books, the Colour In Kate book is apparently flying off the shelves. Pictured, the Duchess of Cambridge in Tuvalu With 31 pictures of Kate’s most memorable outfits, the books cost £5.99 and boast ‘pretty pictures of the divine duchess to colour and complete’. Inside it says: ‘Colour in Kate, a modern style icon. From beautiful ball gowns and formal dresses to casually chic outfits – complete these stunning scenes and add colour to Kate’s wonderful wardrobe.’ Among the images are pictures of Kate dancing in a headdress and ‘grass skirt’ on a visit to Tuvalu and the Solomon Islands, and wearing a cowboy hat and posing with a horse in Canada. Last year William said his wife had joined the rising number of adults who enjoy colouring in as a way of de-stressing. Last year William said his wife had joined the rising number of adults who enjoy colouring in as a way of de-stressing. Pictured, Kate at the Royal Albert Hall The colouring book will raise funds for Historic Royal Palaces, the charity who are responsible for Kensington Palace. Pictured, the royal couple in Honiara, Solomon Islands The book, published by Buster Books, is being sold as part of the fundraising by Historic Royal Palaces, the independent charity responsible for Kensington Palace and other buildings. A spokesman said: ‘We stock a wide variety of products for all ages in our palace shops and online. Our range celebrates the history of the palaces in our care, and the public lives of their royal residents.’ Colour in Kate will be sold at the Buckingham Palace gift shop. Pictured, the Duchess sipping tea during a Diamond Jubilee Tea Party at the British High Commission in Kuala Lumpur Kate donned a stetson in 2011 when she visited a rodeo demonstration during the Calgary Stampede in Canada Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
